result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole D Carrillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possesses Illegal Article, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, 4 days credit granted. The Court will allow for transfer of probation to any other county in Wisconsin.

miscConds.notes: Court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: Jerry Mack or his daughter.
Complete a trauma counseling program.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicole D Carrillo in court, in custody (OTP'd from Ozaukee County Jail), with attorney Justin G Griffis.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented statements to the court.

FELONY WARANING PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
4 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Any other probation.
Court will allow for transfer to any other county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Jerry Mack or his daughter.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Complete a trauma counseling program.

COSTS:  $268 - Court waives the $268 in costs ONLY.

DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Defendant to be returned to Ozaukee County Jail - FORTHIWTH.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
filed, to be produced from Ozaukee County Jail.
